text: hi I'm Melissa Clark through dining
section are you sick of making the same
old Ashkenazi haroset every Passover do
you even know what Ashkenazi haroset is
this year how about trying something new
I've got a recipe for Sephardic harissa
truffles charoset is a symbolic food
that served at all passover seder 'he's
the Ashkenazi version that I grew up
with is made from apples walnuts
cinnamon and a little Passover wine the
Sephardic version is made from mostly
dried fruit and then there are a million
variations you could put apple you could
put banana you could cook it you could
not cook it I'm going to show you one of
the easiest versions the key to this
recipe is to use enough of the dried
dates to get everything to kind of stick
together you can substitute any other
dried fruit you want for the apricots
and the dried cherries that I'm gonna
use you also need to add nuts for the
texture I like a combination of
pistachio and almonds but use whatever
nuts you like then you're just going to
throw all your dried fruit and your nuts
into the processor and process and help
it
once it starts to clump turn it off now
you're gonna add your cinnamon and then
just enough pomegranate juice to make it
all come together the amount of
pomegranate juice depends on how moist
your fruit was to begin with so I'm
going to pour a little bit of the
pomegranate juice into the cinnamon it's
gonna help it distribute more evenly see
this is what you want you see how it's
starting to stick to the sides that's
ready so I probably added about a
tablespoon of pomegranate juice that's
all it needed at this point the hero set
is finished you could just put it in a
bowl and put it right on your stator
table but I'm gonna do something a
little fancier I'm gonna do something
they do in Morocco which is they take
the paste and they roll it into balls
basically making charoset truffles if
you just rolled these into balls they
would stick together so to keep them
separate I'm gonna roll them through
some coconut can make the balls any size
you want no you got to wet your hands
first by the way or it's gonna stick you
can make these a couple of days in
advance you might need two reroll them
in coconut if they seem to have absorbed
it but they'll keep for a while
Sephardic charoset truffles cute tasty
and at least for my family something
different
